Wookmark Viewer is an app designed to help you quickly and easily browse the latest and most popular images on the image bookmarking website Wookmark.com. It also offers the ability to search for images, or find images that match a given color.

This application is free and open source software. You can view the source code for this application on Github at the link below. This application is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. The terms of this license are available at the link below. In addition there are a number of third party libraries which have been used, as detailed below. \nSource: https://github.com/adamsp/wookmark \nLicense: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

AntipodalWall - This is the main 'Pinterest-style' view that is used throughout the app. Wookmark Viewer uses a heavily modified version of this library, originally written by Daniel López Lacalle. The original, as well as my modified version, can be found linked below. AntipodalWall is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. 
Original source: https://github.com/expilu/AntipodalWall 
Modified source: https://github.com/adamsp/AntipodalWall 
License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

SlidingMenu - This is the menu library that provides the menu system used in Wookmark Viewer. I have made some minor modifications to the original (developed by Jeremy Feinstein) to support the ActionBarSherlock library. SlidingMenu is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. Links to the original version, modified version and license can be found below. 
Original source: https://github.com/jfeinstein10/SlidingMenu 
Modified source: https://github.com/adamsp/SlidingMenu 
License: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

LazyList - This library from Fedor Vlasov is used to enable lazy downloading of images off the UI thread. It provides automatic caching of images to the SD card for fast loading later, as well as image scaling to preserve space. I've made a few modifications to make scaling optional and provide some notification when an image has finished loading. This library is licensed under the MIT license. Links to the original source, modified source and license are provided below. 
Original source: https://github.com/thest1/LazyList 
Modified source: https://github.com/adamsp/LazyList 
License: http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT

ActionBarSherlock - This library from Jake Wharton facilitates the use of the ActionBar design pattern on devices running Android 2.x and up. The native ActionBar implementation is used in Android 4.0 and upwards. ActionBarSherlock is licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0. Links to the source code and license can be found below. \nSource: https://github.com/JakeWharton/ActionBarSherlock \nLicense: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
